review: Typical Friday's fare. This one is in the airport. Don't be deceived by the entrance to this place. It looks deceptively small so you might think you will never get a table but it is actually really large once you get past the front entrance.  The service was good. Fast and friendly. My server, Jasmine, was really good. I ordered a medium rare burger and she warned me that it would be very bloody so I took here advice and got medium instead. It was pink in the middle, just the way I like it. My burger was excellent. Really hit the spot.  I was also given the option of several different sides so I got broccoli. I always like when you can get something other than fries. Not that I don't like fries but I don't need to be eating them, if you know what I mean.  Would I come here again next time I'm in the ATL airport? Yes, I would!

They were out of most beers on the menu except for the standard mainstream crap.  Our food took way too long to arrive and we almost left without getting to eat it. Our server was unconcerned and unapologetic. I should have known better.

I had a great experience at the airport TGI Fridays.  I was dreading my solo 3 hour layover in Atlanta, and I was even more worried about the food situation.  I wanted to sit down somewhere, grab a beer and not be rushed.  There was a line out the door at TGI Fridays, but I managed to find a seat at the bar. The woman behind the bar was absolutely phenomenal!  She was super sweet and welcoming, while also staying on top of all of the bar orders.  They have a good assortment of draft beers, and they are very decently priced.  For dinner, I had the Million Dollar Cobb salad with steak.  It was huge!  It included blue cheese, bacon, boiled egg, tomatoes, cucumber, and fresh avocado.  The steak was a delicious addition. Everyone at the bar was so friendly, and I was able to have nice conversations while watching sports on TGI Friday's large bar TVs.  I never felt rushed, and my layover flew by.  The food was wonderful for an airport stop.  I highly recommend!

This location really seems to have gone downhill. They didn't open on time in the morning and there were dirty dishes and liquor bottles all out front. There was trash all over the floor as if they didn't clean the restaurant the night before. The employees that were cleaning were not very professionally dressed and were yelling across the bar to each other. Several of them were actually sitting at the bar watching tv while the bartender was trying to clean up the bar. This isn't my normal experience with this location so not sure what was going on during this visit.

Slow to get food. Burgers were way too cold and pink inside for "medium" and fries were completely limp and cold. No time to send stuff back. Server looked puzzled why we don't like the look of our meals and says he can bring some fresh fries if we want? Why not fresh fries to start?? Pretty much your biggest fear about eating at a sit down restaurant in an airport - everything looked gross and made you feel gross.  And our 3 burgers and cokes add to $47!!!  I've had beers at the bar on work trips - the service is better, but the area has a terrible stale smell.

I've been to TGI Fridays a couple of times but for the first time at this location.I really like their daily soups such as tomato basil and their cocktails. THeir wine assortment is also not bad as well as their appetizers. I usually order the cheeseburger with their signature sauce - all in all a good chain restaurant.

Airport food is rarely good, and this was no exception. The one perk, is the few minutes you get to quietly catch up with your emails and chill before you need to get to your departing gate. There are no outlets, so no option of charging your phone while you wait. Food is not important at this location but service is even worst. The servers have no concept of travelers and their limited time to eat. You get seated and you have to wait easily 10 minutes before someone comes over and introduces themselves.  The food is dry and/or greasy. Kids chicken fingers are heavily breaded and dry. Meanwhile, the pretzel appetizer was so greasy that the bread was drenched in a greasy butter sauce that was soaked.  Ended up drinking my beer, at least that was cold and standing up by the exit with my cash to hunt down my server. Which by the way, Jasmine was hanging out in the kitchen for over 8 minutes. Will skip this location if ever in the Atlanta airport.
Service to slow for airport crowd. Dear Doreen for 10 min and there are plenty of servers just standing y server keep on just passing around. Took to long so I left. Disappointed

Stay AWAY from this place: I sat at the bar and nobody acknowledge me and I waited 10 minutes. The floors is all dirty and full of liquids so, so not put your bag on the floor. Nobody working there seems to care about customers...I left the place with no service and let the person at the front about my service and she smiled. Last time I will get food at TGI Fridays: lesson learned.

I had a delay before my flight and had never flown out of the T terminal before. It does not seem to be as big as the other terminals, and does have limited options for restaurants, so I decided to go here so I could enjoy sitting down and have a drink with my meal. Something that I really appreciated about this location is that when I entered, the hostess asked if I had at least 45 minutes until my flight, because that was the expected amount of time to be served. While that is a long time to wait for food, I was not in a rush, but really appreciated being informed of this prior to being seated. I was given one of the high top tables in the bar area, and was brought a menu immediately after being seated. I ordered a beer and my entree and the beer was brought almost immediately and the meal was brought after about 25 minutes - even better than their estimated time! All of the staff were extremely helpful, and while the food was okay, it was not anything to go out of your way for. If you would like to receive good customer service while having a meal in the airport, I suggest coming here!

I have to start with the statement ' I love Jack Daniel Ribs'. It's OK to judge me. Every time I visit TGIF, it's the half rack of ribs for sure.  I would give TGIF ribs a 4 star, as I love the fall of the bones and the kick to the sauce. This place at the airport was a three. It wasn't the normal falloff the bones saucey ribs I LOvE.  I have even learned to make my version of the jack Daniel sauce at home.

Stopped in for lunch and found a spot by the bar. Bartender was great, very upbeat and even carded me for a bottle beverage. Even though it was extremely crowded, the food came out quickly and accurately. Thumbs up for this TGIF for taking care of customers on a busy Friday lunch hour in one of America's crowded airports.

Had breakfast here.  Service was slow, had to ask for a server to finally have someone wait on us.  Food was dry and apparent had been sitting a while. Bacon side consisted of a single strip of bacon. The potatoes were very dry, had to wash down with water. I have gone to plenty of other TGIF's and this one was definitely the worst have ever visited.

Flew in from California!  Have to say, our server "Todd" was FANTASTIC! Totally took care of us, checked on us CONSTANTLY!! The guy had plenty of tables and juggled them well!  Thanks for the great service!

My flight was delayed so I popped in for breakfast. Had a great steak and eggs! Steak was perfectly cooked and piping hot. The Bloody Mary I ordered was meh and I wouldn't order it again. But that aside, the breakfast did not disappoint!

I always commend restaurants in airports because even though people are waiting for their flights, service should still be good and quick. I got the Barbados Rum Punch which was pretty good and then I got a side Caesar with chicken. You can't go wrong and of course most of the menu items are really good. I gave 5 stars for service
Slow service doesn't taste the same as a regular T.G.I. Friday's was very disappointed I should have just went to the delta sky club and smacked there.
Always a good stop while traveling through the Atlanta airport. Very friendly servers. Food is a little slow but quality is there.
Food too way to long. Not good at all. It was near my gate that was the only reason I stopped in.

location: Central San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: Good service and a decent steak within a reasonable time. Except that i ordered a 10 oz ribeye steak but got a different and smaller cut. I was in a hurry so i did not return it. And like most TGI Friday's, this steak tasted different from other locations. You would think a single ingredient dish like steak can be delivered with greater consistency in the same location or across locations of the same franchise but that's not the case with most franchises​. Making the steak the most expensive order on the menu and yet the one botched more often.
This place smelled like urine and was so dirty I didn't even wait to get the water from the waiter. If the conditions are that bad in the dining room I can't even imagine the kitchen. So gross.
For being inside the airport: it was pretty good. Wife had chicken strips and I had bbq ribs. Very tasty for a full rack.  Now that I'm full: need to nap before my flight to SFO.

Sat at the bar and the bartender was right over to take my drink order and minutes later took my food order. He also explained that the food would take about 30 minutes because they were so busy. While I waited and enjoyed my drink. The food arrived and the bacon cheeseburger was outstanding!  So were the lightly seasoned fries. Could not ask for a better meal or better customer service!!
Long wait for a meal   When it's into that busy.  Utensils were placed on the table with a plastic knife.  Very poor service

i'm probably not spelling their names right and i'm about to hop on a plane so i have to make this quick but orlando and toya were absolutely amazing. i'm just sitting here inbetween flights, expecting so/so service but, toya went above and beyond and the chemistry that she had with her staff including orlando was so entertaining and brightened my day of non stop flying!!! they killed it!!!

I travel domestic and internationally often. Airport food and or restaurants as a whole are more hit than miss and I get that and allow for cocessions. Even with those cocessions I can't in good conscience give this place more than 2 stars. 1 star as a handicap because, it's an airport. If anything is good and doesn't give you the poops then consider yourself lucky. 1 more star for an exceptionally friendly hostess station. Go here for the bar, beer and the tv.  My experience with the food and waitstaff was undesirable. Ordered a simple appetizer pick 3. Food came out 10 minutes before beverages. My potstickers looked anemic. Not sure if they fry them in a fryer or pan fry them but they appeared freezer burned and had a very strange white speckled look to the dough, not at all appetizing. Miso sauce on the boneless wings was cloying sweet and goopy. GARNISH  and celery LOOKED LIKE IT WAS OLD, DRY AND UNSANITARY. Everything was sitting on top of garnish and dried celery including the serving dish of sauce so why would anyone risk eating it.  The food temp was like warm...

For being inside ATL airport this is a pretty sweet spot to watch a game and kill time between flights !!  Decent size bar with a larger beer selection, just know your food will be served with plastic knives to protect everyone lol.
Everyone was super friendly. Great service from staff, food was delicious. Will definitely come here again when I'm at the Atlanta Airport.

I travel often for work so grabbing a bite to eat needs to be quick. This was anything but quick today. Took too long for my iced tea to come. Then by the time I got my spinach dip I had maybe 10 min to enjoy it before needing to go catch my next flight. They didn't seem too crowded though. Won't ever return here.

You know what? For a T.G.I. Friday's, at an airport: this place ain't half bad. I ordered the black bean burger. "You know that doesn't have any meat in it, right?" my server asked. I laughed and said yes. Apparently some people do NOT know that, so he had to check. I had a coupla beers. Did some work. Ate my meal. Was satisfied.

You shouldn't expect much from an airport restaurant to begin with, so the 3 stars here is generous. This entire airport is always INSANE so it's no surprise I had to wait to be seated here. Once I was, I ordered immediately and it still took a good 20 minutes to get my food. The quality was up to what I would expect from any TGI Friday's so I was pleasantly surprised there. But the service was not anything special, definitely not welcoming or particularly helpful. I got in, got my food, got out and made my flight, so I still call it a success! Definitely not the worst place you could eat in an airport.
Friendly service, cold beer, great apps, & a delicious math. Good place to stop for a drink or a quick bite!

First of all the service was terrible. We waited at least 30 minutes for the server to show up at our table. Than my husband ordered a Jack Daniel's burger medium rear and they overlooked it, it was well done instead. I ordered chicken sliders, they just brought me chicken strips stuck between bread, which was sprayed with hot sauce and a few pickles on the side. They were terrible, no flavor and too dry. There was no special sauce or anything on them at all.

Easy stop for your layover in ATL airport.  Great drinks, service and soup. Highly recommend Ultimate Margarita.  It was a little early, but they do serve breakfast.  Small menu but the breakfast plates looked good.

Typical T.G.I. Friday's, but food was fast and decently priced for An airport restaurant, not to mention an exceptionally friendly staff. Not so typical for an airport! Left happily, thanks to a hearty meal and a friendly staff.

I can't say we had a good or bad experience here. We had a layover and went here to eat. We were seated quickly but our table had maple syrup all over it. Not worth complaining the three times we saw our waitress. Food was ok but nothing to brag about or remember. Fine for an airport.
We stopped in for breakfast while waiting for a flight.  Our waiter was very friendly and good at his job.  Eggs, bacon and toast. Nothing fancy but good.

How I heard of this place: We walked by, it was close to our gate and we were hungry, knowing a long flight was ahead and no meals would be served. Type of cuisine: American Grub. Everything from burgers and chicken wings to pasta, ribs, sandwhiches, salads, desserts and that's just the tip of the iceburg. Ambiance: The loud, neon-lit space, very reminiscent of a 1950s diner welcomes all weary travelers into its crowded ranks. Everything from black and white checkered wall print, to enlarged photographs of the Hollywood sign, and various signs from Las Vegas are colorfully collaged on the walls, from framed black and white photos of the "Ghostbusters" trio and Elvis Presley, to a motorized bike, pool balls in a triangle and one drum protruding from the walls. Brighly colored media prints of Marilyn Monroe, white bulbs connected to spell out the word KITCHEN, wood-paneled walls (where one can see them), and stars spangling the hanging ceiling lamps and the glass around our mini booth. What I ordered: Boneless Buffalo Wings ($11.43), topped with Classic Buffalo Sauce, served ith celery, ranch and Bleu cheese dressings, the New Steakhouse Bleu Cheese Burger ($10.89), crumbled bleu cheese, applewood-smoked bacon, caramelized onions and garlic maison butter served over a grilled 100% USDA choice Black Angus beef patty, all contained within a hearty brioche bun, topped with fresh lettuce, pickles, onion and vine-ripened tomatoes, and the California Club ($9.67), which included mesquite-smoked turkey breast, applewood-smoked bacon, ham and Monterey Jack cheese on toasted ciabatta bread with Romaine lettuce, tomatoes, avocado and mayo. Each of our meals came with a side of seasoned fries. What I loved: Boneless Buffalo-flavored Chicken Wings. The seasoned fries were a very close second. Why I loved it: While I am most accustomed to finding a quick grab-and-go snack at airports where I have a layover, Chris seems to know all of the best places to find a sit-down restaurant. When we travel together, there is almost no other option. Cost: Average ($9.67 - $10.89 per burger/sandwich)

Eh, it's Friday's.  Surprised by this restaurant's policy of carding everyone.  Ask me for ID when I order a drink equals canceled drink and water only.  I have to put up with showing ID at TSA...don't want to deal with it while trying to relax at dinner.  Before someone flames me for over-reacting to a "policy"...I'm over 50 and look it.   Food was hot, service was fast.  Too many french fries,  too few ribs.  But ok.  Quiet place to sit and relax.  Saw some flight crew members which is always a good sign.
Very good salad,  nice people,  they wanted me to feel comfortable.   This review is to the point,  why did yelp require more.   My Texas tea was just like at home.  Thanks

Bad and slow service and attitude = 1 star.   Now I know it's an airport location and this is TGI Friday's...but our server was not meant for the service industry.  We ordered the BFM margarita, but asked for skinny version...she didn't know what that was, so we told her.  Not only were we overcharged for this special margarita, but they didn't add the grand marnier.  She gave us attitude about it and then charged extra $20. to bring us 2 shots.  Don't think TGI Friday is a place for $25. margaritas!!  Food was fine. We paid the bill, but it was ridiculous as was her attitude.

Disorganized and unaccommodating wait staff. Took 45+ minutes for our food to arrive and we ended up having to take it to-go to catch our flight. Many better, faster, and more friendly options in this terminal if you are hungry. On the other hand, if you aren't in a hurry, you may just enjoy this place.

TGIF always has a decent breakfast and prices considering it is in this airport.  This is my go-to place when I'm traveling through Atlanta's airport.  It has been consistent in its service, quality and quantity of food.
Slowest service by far at an airport restaurant that I have ever experience.  Food was marginal as well.  I do not recommend eating here.

Sat at bar to avoid line up for afternoon lunch prior to boarding a delta flight.  Looks good, great friendly service but seating at bar is uncomfortable.   Knees hit the bar so you have to lean in to eat your meal.  Granite counters, small wood tables best for singles not couples or large parties.

Dined here in between layovers from ATL to New Orleans this past weekend and  while I've never been uber impressed by the food at Friday's, the customer service here was amazing! Despite the alleged wait time being 20-25 minutes, we were seated in 3-5 (a huge plus). Drinks arrived timely and the staff as an entirety were hilarious, upbeat and refreshing. This definitely managed to reduce the stress associated with flying. Thanks guys.

Great airport experience! I ordered Pinot noir and the Cobb salad with steak. Both were delicious- the medium rare steak was more tender than I expected, and the salad came with a half of a fresh avocado and tons of bacon. It seems like there is a line for the tables, but the bar serves food and makes for a quicker meal.

Went here while waiting for a flight and had the pleasure of having Kathia as my server. She was so nice and friendly and made my experience so great!!! Everyone was so nice and friendly, I will definitely come back next time I'm at the ATL airport

It's a TGI Friday's.. I've been here a few times, most recently during the Delta fiasco last week. The staff is very nice and even during the Delta mess had seats available with no wait. The pretzel appetizer is pretty yummy with the cheese sauce. Kinda wish they would give you more cheese sauce but heck guess it's unhealthy enough! Can't go wrong with the Jack Daniel's chicken sandwich. Prices seem to be a bit high however just gotta remember your at an airport. No complaints here. I'd definitely recommend stopping in even if it's just for an appetizer to re-charge as you continue on your journey.

I always stop here as I'm passing through this airport.  The chicken jack strips are one of my favorite dishes from any restaurant, and they're consistent from location to location. They can be busy, but they keep the crowd moving pretty well. No alcohol before 12 on Sundays around here, so I hope you're not craving a mimosa.

Can't give you much of a review.  Arrived at restaurant at 927pm.  (Closes at 1030p). Was told I couldn't be seated because the restaurant was closing soon.  Several tables open in front of bar area, but hostess wouldn't accommodate.  Walked right across to the Sam Adams brewhouse where they were happy to seat me!

Our waitress, Daisy, was friendly and provided fast, quality service. 5 stars.  The hostess who seated us was also super friendly! We ordered the Black Bean Burgers with seasoned fries. The burger patty was the spicy black bean patty one can get at Costco. We personally like it. The lettuce, tomatoes and slice of avocado on the sandwich though were subpar. The tomato was barely red. The lettuce was white, instead of green. The avocado slice was small, hard, and had black spots. The seasoned fries were cooked perfectly but OVERLY salted. I ordered some Jack Daniels Sauce and pretty much covered everything with it. This made things slightly better. Overall Entree 2.5 stars.  Would I return again? I don't think so. Not enough veggie options and low food quality.

Great food, but it took a long time for us just having burgers. Especially inconvenient with short layovers and such. Go here for sure if you have an hour because the food is fantastic. I ordered a classic burger add bacon and an appetizer of mozzarella sticks that were very well presented.

Friday's at Atlanta airport is a decent place to have a meal while waiting for your flight. Service is extremely friendly and your food comes out fairly quickly. It's your typical Friday's fare, and is a nice change from the plethora of fast food places in the airport.  I had a cheeseburger and a wedge salad instead of fries, and my server simply traded the salad for the fries, so it did not cost me any extra- most other places would of charged my for the salad!  My wife had a cheeseburger as well, our bill was only 20 bucks. But we had no alcoholic drinks. A good choice- IF you give yourself the time- even though they are quick, it is a busy restaurant and it took us about 45 minutes from ordering to leaving. Not bad, but thought you should know.

I found this to be a comfort zone in the midst of a hairy airport. The young lady who served me was remarkably friendly and though she was swamped with tables she managed her time well. The food was as expected, average, but considering it was an airport location I did not have high expectations.

Bad service. Ordered vodka and sprite, 2 of them. Get the bill and see each was $10 and I was served GREY GOOSE vodkas. I asked the waiter what's the house vodka and he says there isn't one. I ask is it normal to give top shelf liquor and he replies well you never specified so I just grabbed one. Never apologized or offered a discount or any kind, just blamed me. Similarly earlier in the meal my husband asked for no onion on his salad. His sandwich had fried onion that he wanted. Food arrived sans onion on both. An honest mistake and no big deal. Except when my husband mentioned it the waiter again blamed us. "You said no onion". A simple oops, I misunderstood would've been a more appropriate answer.  Yes, it's an airport restaurant, but I really feel this waiter purposely tried to increase his tip with a higher priced drink, and was rude to boot.

Couldn't tell you the last time I've eaten at TGI Fridays but when it's the Sunday after Christmas... your options are slim. Aside from the completely incompetent diner next to us who boomed into his phone our whole lunch, the experience was fine. Food was hot and fast, service friendly, and the bill not too large.  Probably would sit in the bar next time since it is an airport and people are cray.
Leaking stale beer "pond"  on the floor,  apparently for weeks,  YIKES!!!  Plus some cloud of flying gnats,  no joke here.  Go somewhere else... Seriously!!!

We had a long layover, and after eating Spanish food drenched in salsa for two weeks, we were excited at the idea of having a burger or salmon before heading for home, sweet home. Their burgers were perfect, and the salmon amazing. What stood out the most was our amazing server, Karla! The whole resteraunt was running smooth despite the endless rush of people, and Karla was on point with us. Moment the drink was empty? Boom! Karla. Burger finished? Poof, Karla! A waitress, myself, we were beyond impressed with her and the rest of the staff at tgi. Thank you for making a hellish layover turn amazing!

With our family on a layover and was expecting bare minimum. The servers are very nice, attentive and plentiful. Even on a busy afternoon.  We did not feel rushed and had a nice place to rest and refuel. The food came pretty quickly and was very good. All this made the final leg of our trip much more pleasant!

Amongst many choices, we landed here on a stopover flight. Dinner was very enjoyable for a trio traveling on business. Two of us chose the shrimp and chicken with Jack Danniel's sauce, very lovely presented and great taste. The other party ordered the turkey burger that she enjoyed. Kennie, the waiter, was charming and soooo patient in dealing with our split checks. I enjoyed Friday's this time so much!!!

After 2 low star scores I am on a role.  But guess what.  We loved our experience.  Long layover so we thought we would waste some time and sit down and have a drink and some snacks.  We just kept remarking that there must be a contest to see who can be nicest.  Everyone was greeted nicely when they came in.  On the way to the table conversations between hostess and diners kept happening.  Smiles abounded.  I wish I could give a 4.5 but not an option.  Can't give a national chain a 5 for frozen food but had such a good experience on our bad layover that I wanted to give them a big thumbs up.  Thanks for a great experience.

my previous reveiw is explaining my families recent experience at this establishment and remains the same. this update is in response to Theresa S. and her caddy "compliment" Perhaps you are a member of the team at this TGI Friday's and many of your team members share your same attitude, which would explain why your store has a two star rating.  Theresa S. Writes: "Such a positive reveiw - we're grateful you took the time to write. Thanks!  Sent by Theresa S.   Theresa S.   Unfortunately, my review wasn't positive, but it was truthful. It was a very negative experience. However, if my criticism for this establishment is taken, noted and my complaints corrected then something very positive could come from my negative reveiw as well as all the other many, many negative reviews and this TGIF might become a better example of what TGIF's should be.  Your welcome!

Not typically a chain-restaurant kind of guy, but hey: I was in the Atlanta airport on a lay-over, needed a beer, and needed to watch the French Open on tv.  It answered all of my needs.  The bartender was actually great, quick even though traffic was high, and was ok with me just chillin for a while on my laptop (they have Wifi, or at least the airport does) as I waited 5 hrs for my next flight.  If I'm ever at the airport and that terminal again, I'd stop in.

They are the worst!!!! Waited nearly 15 minutes to get service, ignored by the servers. The excuse was that they were changing shifts...sooooo customers get ignored because the shift change, really lame excuse.  As I sat waiting this other person had ordered his food and it took over 30 minutes for him to get it. Nothing complicated mind you, and it wasn't busy at 4:30 in the afternoon. A lady came in and sat behind me. She asked me if I had been waiting long? I told her it had been over 10 minutes. They came to her and apologized, not saying anything to me even though I had been sitting here much longer than she had. She was very kind and told the lackadaisical server that I had been sitting there longer waiting. So my point if people in Atlanta sit there and give me this Black lives matter why is it that the African American customers got smiles and apologies and the white gentleman and I didn't even get a look or greeting, that is Messed up!

I never got in the door. This review is 100% about the hostess. As I walked up and requested a table (I had a call to make so didn't want to sit at the bar), the hostess appeared to be getting my information. As she was about to seat me, the second hostess had the girl give the table to the couple who just lined up behind me. After that, she proceeded to start taking names from the line that continued to form. A third employee then asked me what I needed and I reminded them, 'a table'. At that point, the sassy line taker asked me my name and I told her and reminded her I've been here the whole time (she was adding my name to the bottom of her list!) At that statement I got the death glare and she refused to even acknowledge me. I pat her on the shoulder, said okay, and walked away at that. When you consider this review, consider I'm also a part-time cocktail waitress so I give people a lot of slack. She was just horrible and I'm not going back. Remember back when Fridays had the best of the best? Sigh...

It's a TGI Friday's and it's airport food...so you can do a lot worse but you can certainly do a lot better.  There aren't a ton of sit down options in this part of the airport so we had to wait about 10 minutes or so for our table.  It's not the biggest place so be prepared for a wait.  We were seated at a booth away from a lot of the congestion so I was happy about that.  After a few minutes or so, our waitress appeared and she could have been a lot more friendly.  Maybe she was having a bad day.   I went with a soda and some type of chicken salad.  After a reasonable amount of time, our food was served.  My salad looked pretty dry and after the first bite, I knew they didn't serve any dressing with it.  I asked my waitress to bring some out.  After about 5-10 minutes, I finally got some dressing.  The salad was actually pretty good and it was a nice size.  I was happy about that.   Overall, it was just an OK experience.  We had to wait a bunch, both pre-meal and during the meal.  I wouldn't be completely opposed to coming back but I'd probably see if other restaurants had less of a wait time.

Our service was awful. Drinks didn't come out for 20 mins.   Appetizers came out before the drinks. Food was good. The server never came to check on us.  I had to get a manager to find our waiter finally so we could pay.

Amazing that Fridays would keep this open with the poor service and food.  Seems always some drama within.  Today, credit machines not working, no bread, out of Coke. Really, No Coke, in Atlanta the home of Coke you can't go and get s case or someone to service this place.  If I was not hooked on Jack Daniels BBQ I would never come here.

normally, I'd not set foot in this place but this terminal leaves no option. My researcher determined that this spot has the cheapest, coldest beer- ask for a large if you got they lay over blues. The bonus of the visit was our server, Xavier, who should be working in a multi-national sales force he's so personal, persuasive, & smooth. He'll rattle off specials like a machine gun and remember your name after he checks your Id. Amazing.

Best Friday's I've eaten at in a while.  Enjoyed the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich and fries. The sandwich was very good. The fries were ok. Service was very friendly.  Not a place to eat at if you have a short layover. For a 2 hour layover it was just right. Still had about 30 mins left before the plane boarded.
Really great service here. Very nice staff. Had Keba for a waitress and she had great recommendations and was very sweet. Great place to go during long layovers.
Grab the patio if possible.
Always stop he when flying delta. The food is always consistent and good.  The staff is warm and friendly and they pour great drinks!  I recommend this place in B terminal.

For sit down eating, Fridays offers the usual fare. That level of variety allows you to avoid much of the greasy, deep fried everything elsewhere through the Atlanta Airport.  Yes, Fridays has the fried stuff, but they have plenty more to choose from. And unlike most eateries in the airport, this location of Fridays does not jack up the menu prices.  They are the same as on the outside. Salads are great.  Breakfast is the best in the airport.  The 3 egg Western omelet ($5.99) was great. Coffee was strong, yet smooth.

Ok, kinda smells like stale beer, like not clean. However, I did order a California club sandwich w/fries. It was really tasty, fresh, and the fries were hot and crisp. The service was good too. She brought a drink refill before I asked.  Caveat: It was really early and only 3 people eating. It gets crowded from time-to-time.

I had enough time on my layover to eat at TGIF though I usually don't eat at sit down places in the airport because I like to stretch my legs and walk the terminals.  The food was pretty good though it's typical fare and usual airport pricing.  The service was good.

Extremely disappointed, store#2486 So with plenty of time in hand we came to favorite place AKA Fridays, server was nice and that was the only good part of story. She took our order and then vanished, we waited 30 minutes before drink can be served and suddenly clock startd ticking and there was no food to be seen anywhere. I am usually a quite guy with patience but raised my concern with store manager and in between we still dont see our server. Finally food appeared, we rushed ourself as clearly they were short staffed in kitchen but no one care to come and offer any explanation, we didn't enjoy this meal and regretted coming here. If anyone care please ask store manager about time management between 1200-130 pm,(04/07/14) Server- Melissa( why did you vanished on us?) This needs to be addressed to avoid hassle for flying travelers, WILL NEVER COME TO THIS LOCATION EVER.

I hail from the land of no TGI Friday's and so now and then when I fly through ATL, I feel the need to stop and have a meal.  I always forget that TGI isn't my fave place to eat because the meals always seem so bland and boring.  The one kudos I will give is that in the airport locations, they certainly know how to quickly move you in and out of the tables.  Our server was friendly and we ate and were out in 40 mins or less but the food was just eh.  I know it's better than the food court options of Popeye's or Burger King, etc. but you will be paying full price for food that's sub-par.

Had to push a bit to get a good table by the Windows....omelette and toast were cold...not entirely sure thee bacon was real...or fresh?  service was mediocre....went because ratings were high, especially for an airport place, but now see there were only 4 prior ratings.
Smells of really stale beer. Water tastes funny. Fruit flies everywhere. This place is filthy and needs to be closed down and thoroughly cleaned.
Very good meal and service for airport dinning.  Prompt service, food was fresh and hot and hit the spot for late dinner.

Whenever I fly out of concourse B, this is usually my go to choice for a sit down meal.  The place is usually quite busy even more so in recent months since the Chili's in concourse A closed, but they have a lot of seating, and they move people in and out quick.  Even with a line of 8 - 10 parties waiting for seating, you know your wait won't be more than 10 minutes for a table.   The fare is standard TGI Friday's.  I'm a fan of the potstickers, the cobb salad, and the dragonfire chicken.  Every now and then when I need to get greasy, the fried shrimp or chicken tenders with fries hits the spot.  With a full bar and decent beer selection (for an airport vendor), you can count on being able to quench your thirst as well Service has always been friendly and while the hostesses rarely seem thrilled to be bothered by another guest, the waiter/waitress makes up for it with attentive service and they seem to understand that travellers in a hurry to make a flight really don't want to chit chat.

Nothing like  a trip that should have been 5 hours entering into its 14th. Yes, a very sad tale of said business traveler stuck in Hotlanta airport due to a 3 hour flight delay. In fact, the entire airport was closed, so you can imagine what that did to everyone's moods? All the finer dining choices were jam backed with people queuing up. I decided not for me. I already had enough of people having been squeezed in next to them for the past four hours. I went with the strawberry salad, red Poweraide and a chocolate brownie. The salad was good, a little fresher than I had expected so nothing really to complain on that end. The brownie, well, it was not so great, but of course I ate it. What else was I suppose to do with the next few hours? Overall, I was happy with my plan on finding non fast food without having to wait and jockey for a seat. The food quality was higher than I expected, which means I had a good experience and would consider going again the next time I am in need.
I ordered the JD Chicken here. The order came out really fast and I was surprised. After taking two bites I noticed my chicken was raw. I hope I don't die......

Food is great, Myriam waitress is awesome, smiley, fun and great service. Can't say much good about the rest of the female staff, they seemed to be snobbish to the male waiters and the hostess was down right rude. I wish I had taken down her name.

I can't believe I am giving a TGIFriday's a 5 star review, but here it goes.   I met some others in the International Terminal at the ATL airport a few hours before our flight for Italy was slated to leave.  We decided to grab a drink and some food at the TGIFriday's there, and were actually really pleased. I've been to one of these at home, and had a terrible experience.  Ugh. We got some appetizers and a few drinks from their fancy cocktail menu.  First of all, my drink was GOOD, and I'm picky.  It was Grey Goose, basil, peach nectar and St Germain.  Not something I expected to find there.  It was delicious and refreshing, and they weren't shy with the Grey Goose.  The food was exactly what we expected.  A lot of fried stuff, pretty good but nothing to write home about.  I can't remember the name of our server, but she was friendly, quick and very efficient.   On our way out of the country, the last thing you want to do is blow tons of money on a meal at the airport before you even leave.  For the price we paid, I was very pleased with the drink, food, and service we received at this place!
Sizzling chicken and spinach was awful.  Only reason I'm giving it two stars is that my girlfriend enjoyed her salad.

I am at the T.G.I. Fridays at the baggage claim area..and I must say I am pleased. I got bumped from a flight..I will post about them later..and since I have a couple of hours until my next flight I decided to eat.  I sat at the bar and the bartender Angela is awesome. She remembers everyone's name and is so pleasant.  Sure she is working for tips but she goes above and beyond niceness.  The food was typical, a little pricey but its the airport. The good: Great service..something I really needed. The bad: pricey Overall: Not a bad place to eat when you are hungry.

Surprisingly good- really excellent service and so nice to sit at a table out of the high traffic areas. Excellent wine selection, love the pretzel and cheese sauce appetizer. Jack Daniels burger  never disappoints

With a two hour layover, I figured I would give Friday's a try since they served breakfast vs hitting up one of the Terminal B food court contestants. Especially since the Popeye's closed :( All in all, this was an ok meal as I stuck to the limited breakfast items vs ordering off the regular menu, which is an option. The scrambled eggs were fluffy and moist, decent sausage and hash browns and a slightly above average piece of wheat toast. It was served hot and with a smile.  I would likely never choose Friday's for lunch or dinner but, if in a similar situation in  the ATL airport on down the road, I would definitely give breakfast another whirl.
It's FRIDAY's if you dont know what they have/serve then maybe you should go somewhere else.  I suggest you get the Long Island while you are there!
There's a lot servers in here just standing around and here we wait.  Like 7 people standing, watching. ..? One has loudly complained about bad tips twice.  Ummmm......

4 stars for a TGI Fridays? Who does that?  Here's the thing - the breakfast at TGIF in the airports is great! I was shocked as hell, too, but it's true. Sure, it's all relative, so set your expectations accordingly.  Whenever I'm early for a Monday morning flight I always hit this place up. Egg white omelet with bacon and cheese, wheat toast - that's my standard. And, dude! It's $5.99. Now that may not be super cheap at your neighborhood hole in the wall cafe you love so much, but this is an airport. And that's a great price for an airport...especially since it's pretty damn good.

Was having a rough day due to missing my connecting flight, but was happy I was going to get some dinner. Unfortunately the only good thing about Fridays was the hostess and my food.... Well after they didn't have my first choice, my second choice was good. However, my waitress was extremely rude! She barely said 2 words to me and was not attentive at all. Should not have come here!

SO I was waiting for a flight and needed to get a bite to eat so I stopped in TGI Fridays.  I was seated quickly and was met my my server, Jasmine.  She had a bubbling personality, and engaged in some small talk pleasantries.  She was very nice and quickly ran through the specials.  This is the first time I had been inside a fridays in probably over 20 years and I have to say the menu is upscale compared to what I was expecting. I was expecting a typical greasy fare. But what I found was dramatically different.  The menu was very nice and it all sounded delicious. I ended up ordering a ribeye that was delicious.  Jasmine was very attentive and always made sure I was hydrated. :) she engaged in pleasant conversation throughout my time there.   Excellent waitstaff and very good food.
Food was disgusting.  Scrambled eggs cold and overcooked.  Pancakes like rubber.  Cold toast. Mistake eating breakfast here.  Never again!!!!!

This was the worst service we received while visiting Atlanta.  The server was initially very friendly.  I ordered a coke but she brought me a diet coke.  I very politely (with a smile on my face) asked for a regular coke and her expression was as though I had said something hateful to her.  Even my wife noticed her negative reaction.  The server then proceeded to wait on other tables and then disappeared for well over five minutes - ignoring my request.  I finally took my drink up to the bar to get a coke, and even the bartender ignored me.  Our server finally saw me standing at the bar and then rushed over to get me a coke.  After she served our food, we never saw her again.  I ate my meal and drank my one drink.  I guess she saw me ask another waitress for our check, because she came running from the back.  I'm usually a great tipper, and I always treat servers with respect. The up side is my burger was very good.  Too bad our server ruined the experience.
Mediocre at best. Lack of detail to service an airport restaurants need to be fast. Food was not good. The drowned both out salads. Burger was ok but I'd recommend going elsewhere.
Consistently horrible bartenders.  Done with that place.  They need to hire and train people with the slightest awareness of customer service.  This would make a significant improvement.

The TGI Friday's in the Atlanta airport delivers everything a traveler needs: speed of service, competent food, and a good place to relax and decompress on a layover. The food, as I said, is competent but uninspired; typical TGI Friday's fare. The chicken tenders were well-prepared but I could have used a lot more honey-mustard sauce than provided; they were very chinchy on the condiments. All in all an above-average expenence and definitely reliable.

The food here was fine - nothing more or less than I'd expect from a TGI Friday's in the airport. However, I have a real problem with sitting down for a meal and hearing the staff chatting with each other loudly saying "F this, F that." That behavior is not acceptable and is the last thing I want to deal with when I am traveling. It is inappropriate and disrespectful. NEVER AGAIN.

What a gross breakfast! My dog literally would not eat the food! (yes he travels with me) slow service and the waitress didn't care about helping waiting on us. It was terrible. It's an airport should be fast it's not like they really cook anything.

Not great. Dirty plate, dirty glass, terrible salad. Super friendly service though. If you want bar food and beer, it's a fine choice. If you want food that tastes good, I'd recommend Cafe Intermezzo next door.

Food was decent for an airport restaurant (granted, someone at my table asked for garlic aioli for his fries... Be aware it's an American chain restaurant, not a gourmet burger bar). They need a bag check (or just more room between tables for your roll-aboard). Awful music.

There are thousands of these place everywhere, we were in the concourse B one. Absolutely terrible place--the food about the worst I've been served in any restaurant. Admittedly I was being a bit naive in ordering boneless chicken wings and not reading the fine print-if there was any fine print. These are not chicken wings, they are chunks of white chicken meat, fried and pasted overall with a foul tasting red sauce and served with an equally foul tasting and looking white dipping sauce. The celery was good. Green, crisp. Real celery. The rest was crap, expensive crap. Just in case there is any fine print anywhere in any of the tgifs I've now decided to avoid them all. Any place that can commit a culinary crime of this magnitude deserves a wide berth. Why won't they let you vote less that one I wonder?
